intro: Monsonia heliotropioides var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered monsonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms. The species is relatively drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.
